236,"TRIM-GT-1341/2017","12/4/2017 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","8","The institution does not consider IRB parameters, for all its relevant portfolios, within its:
(a) corporate governance functions;
(b) collection and recovery processes.
,,The institution is expected to use the internal ratings and default and loss estimates within its corporate governance functions.
In particular, IRB parameters are expected to play an important role in the institution's internal reporting and portfolio credit risk monitoring.

The institution is expected to have a structured reporting system on risk measured by the IRB risk parameters. This reporting framework should contain information about frequency, recipients and contents (if possible broken down by segment, portfolio and product). The reports should be accompanied by comments and explanations on the numbers provided as well as by qualitative assessments, to enable recipients to fully understand the potential underlying risks.
The institution is expected to consider and document IRB parameters (or otherwise explain the reasoning behind not using them) also within its collection and recovery processes.

With regard to the collection process, the institution is expected to have in place risk management procedures which are triggered in advance of the exposure’s default (e.g. early collection calls) and based – among other indicators – on the internal ratings or risk drivers. Regarding the recovery process, the institution is expected to have in place rules, strategies or procedures that take into consideration, inter alia, the LGD/ expected loss best estimate (ELBE) values, as well as the set-aside provisions.

Furthermore, in case the institution utilises adjusted IRB risk parameters, the differences from the regulatory parameters shall be fully justified and properly documented within the institution’s documentation.
The institution is expected to integrate the IRB risk parameters within the aforementioned areas and provide evidence of their implementation.

238,"TRIM-GT-1341/2017","12/4/2017 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB","PD","Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","10","The institution does not have in place defined and formalised maximum extents for overriding the rating assigned to its exposures for its relevant portfolios. Therefore, the override process could lead to non-prudent, unintended results.",,"The institution is expected to have in place documented policies for overrides regarding the portfolios to which the override process is applied. The aforementioned policies shall define the maximum extent of overrides (in terms of, for example, maximum number of notches up/down and maximum share of overridden exposures), also considering models/portfolios specificities.

Furthermore, the overrides' extents should be considered within the analysis on overrides carried out by the institution (e.g. overrides distribution by notches up/down) and be part of the corresponding reporting documentation.
The institution is expected to amend the override policies accordingly and provide evidence of their implementation.

,,,,,,,,Risco Médio","9/29/2018 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Given the controls and rules-based process described in the previous section, NB believes our current override process is not likely to lead to non-prudent, unintended results. Furthermore, we intend to make the process a more robust one with clearly defined and documented policies.
Accordingly, NB is going to develop and document an overrides policy. We envisage the following topics as the main ones to be addressed:
• Definition of override. We intend to apply the definition as in the General Topics chapter of the “ECB guide to internal models”;
• Risk models/portfolios where overrides are allowed;
• Decision process for overrides, meaning a definition of who is empowered to approve overrides;
• Maximum number of notches up/down;
• Maximum share of overridden exposures;
• Documentation requirements including the justification for triggering the override process;
• Reporting requirements, ie, which functions (CRCU?; internal validation function?) should the overrides be reported to.

Therefore, the overall override' monitoring process could lead to unintended results.",,"The institution is expected to monitor the overrides' distribution in order to identify potential models' weaknesses and address them in case internally defined override's thresholds have been breached.

The institution should identify and formalise specific criteria for assessing whether or not the number and justifications for overrides indicate significant weaknesses of the rating model and whether this is a reason to take ad-hoc actions (e.g. a model change).

240,"TRIM-GT-1341/2017","12/4/2017 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","12","The institution does not present a process that allows for an adequate classification of the changes or extensions, as ruled by Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 and Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 529/2014.
In particular, the institution does not involve a unit independent from the one responsible for the first classification of change or extension in the classification process.
,,The institution is expected to enhance the classification process to ensure the accuracy of the impact assessment and the correctness and consistency of the resulting classification.

The institution is expected to involve an independent unit that has the responsibility to confirm the classification proposed by the unit responsible for the first classification of the change/extension.

,,,,,,,,Risco Médio","9/30/2018 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Novo Banco is conscious that in order to enhance the classification process we have to address the two following topics: (i) management of changes/extensions to the IRB approach that are out of the scope of the Risk Department and (ii) decision on which unit will be responsible to confirm the classification proposed by the unit in charge of the first classification of the change/extension. Both topics are due to assessment by NB’s CRO and decision by the Management Body.

In what concerns the involvement of an independent unit that has the responsibility to confirm the classification proposed by the unit responsible for the first classification of the change/extension, it is our opinion that this is an activity that should be positioned into a second line of defence unit.
Hence, this issue will be addressed in the two following contexts:
i. The revision of the internal validation standards, aiming the assignment to the validation function of two main roles regarding the IRB “change policy”, as follows:

a) In a first moment, immediately following the first classification, to confirm the classification of any changes or extensions made by the unit responsible for the first classification; this procedure ensures the “four-eye principle”, consisting of an assessment of the initial classification by an independent unit (ECB Guide, paragraph 109);

b) In the case of extensions and changes classified as requiring the competent authorities’ approval, the validation function is responsible for issuing the reports of the institutions’ independent review or validation, as ruled by the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 529/2014.
ii. The revision of the “change policy” process, as herein required by the supervisor and taking in consideration all the applicable legal requirements (namely, the ECB Guide, chapter 8)..

In addition to the intervention of a second line of defence in this process, the audit function as third line of defence, will continue to perform recurrent audits of the change policy, as it has been already doing.
Proposed timelines for reviewing the internal validation standards: 30 September 2018.

241,"TRIM-GT-1341/2017","12/4/2017 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","13","The institution does not present a structured process to perform the quantitative impact assessment.",,"The institution should use transparent definitions and clear internal procedures in order to perform the quantitative impact assessment according to the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) no. 529/2014. 242,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DSI",,,"IRB","PD e LGD","Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","F#1","The content of the documentation related to IRB IT infrastructure is incomplete","O1","The documentation provided by the Supervised Entity regarding the IT infrastructure evidenced the following weaknesses:

• application manuals are outdated, containing references to the previous institution and listing application changes to be performed when they were already implemented or dropped. Additionally, some application manuals of systems referenced in the PD and LGD flows were missing;

• the manual excel file used as input for LGD modelling (foreclosures/lieu of payment), has a supporting document that does not allow to gain a clear understanding of the content of each field. This leads to the misinterpretation of some data content and therefore to an erroneous usage of information;
• although the housing loans internal ratings based (IRB) model data flows were documented, they were created specifically for the scope of the TRIM mission;
• the LGD cash flow mandatory tests revealed that in the LGD data flow, some data transformations performed lack proper documentation for a third party to gain a clear understanding.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since the Supervised Entity does not ensure that operational details of its rating systems are fully documented. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 32, Article 77(1)(a) and Article 78(1) of EBA/RTS/2016/037.",,,,,,,"The Supervised Entity shall enrich the documentation related to the IRB IT infrastructure by:
• documenting and updating source systems application manuals that are missing or outdated;
• updating supporting documents of manual files used as input for LGD modelling, such as the foreclosures/lieu of payment excel file, ensuring a clear understanding of the content of each field; and
• ensuring that all data extractions and transformations between system layers of the LGD data flow are documented.","Risco Médio","2/28/2020 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"2º Sponsor: DRG/DCCF

243,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Data Quality","F#2","Lack of consistency of IRB data within the infrastructure choice

The Supervised Entity has an internal Data Warehouse (DWH) implemented which is not used for IRB purposes, although it is under the data quality framework. Instead, other sources of information, including manual files with few controls are being used, leading to data inconsistencies.
It emerged that:

• for foreclosure information purposes, manual input information with no controls on its consistency in terms of data inputs for LGD model is used. This may lead to incorrect usage of cash flow information in the LGD model inputs. Additionally, analysed LGD cash flow test revealed data inconsistencies derived by: i) human errors in the fulfilment of the file; and ii) reversal of the cash flow amount;

• although Exposure at Default (EAD) information is available in the DWH, for IRB purposes this information is received through a database only used by the modelling team. Additional tests regarding this information confirmed that the data used for EAD calculation has significant data inconsistencies when compared to the DWH, which should be further investigated and mitigated.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since the Supervised Entity does not ensure the collection and storage of all the relevant data. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Articles 76 and 78 of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and Paragraphs 15 and 16 of EBA/GL/2017/16. (EBA/GL/2017/16: Guidelines on PD estimation, LGD estimation and the treatment of defaulted exposures of 20 November 2017.)","O2","The Supervised Entity shall ensure accuracy and consistency of all data used for IRB purposes through appropriate data controls. In the process of data collection, the different data sources shall be analysed in order to justify the choice of data used in the IRB flow.

The Supervised Entity shall use data from data quality framework, namely from the DWH. Where such data is not available in the data quality framework, the Supervised Entity may use manual input files, provided that data quality controls are implemented to address potential weaknesses that may arise by the use of these sources of information.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. Deverá ser incluida na decisão final da IMI de CH","3/17/2021 05:00 PM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","10/14/2024 08:45 AM"

244,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DCCF",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Data Quality","F#3","The data quality framework in place does not provide full coverage of the IRB data chain
The Supervised Entity's data quality framework is not complete and does not allow a comprehensive coverage of the IRB process, according to the following:

• the data quality framework only covers data from DWH and Information Management application (AGI) layers, while data quality controls are lacking for the modelling database, the recovery layer and the Current Exposure database;

• the data quality controls in place do not cover the data chain end to end. PD and LGD mandatory tests detected inconsistencies that could be mitigated if proper controls were implemented in the modelling layer;
• the data quality control process requires manual intervention in the way that the data quality team has to always check the emails to identify problems in the data;
• although data quality principles, policies and roles were approved by the executive committee on 2 August 2017, they are still not documented in the internal policies of the Supervised Entity;

• the data quality report produced by the Supervised Entity is related only to the control framework in place, therefore not providing a full coverage of the quality of data at all stages of the IRB lifecycle;

• the data quality report in place is only for the use of the unit that produces and works directly with such information, not allowing a third party to gain clear and full understanding of the metrics presented, as no comments are made to interpret, support and justify the level of exceptions.
• although there are some monthly analysis related to the PD portfolio, no evidence was found regarding LGD monitoring;

• there are no defined business metrics or data quality standards; therefore the Supervised Entity does not have defined thresholds/tolerance levels for the execution of the controls in place. The existing traffic light system is not aligned with the business needs and by itself does not allow to understand the impact and severity of the exceptions;

• although the Supervised Entity has allocated ownership for all system/applications along the IRB data flow, no evidence of properly formalised data ownership along the IRB data chain (i.e. data processing) was found.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since the Supervised Entity does not ensure accuracy, completeness and appropriateness of the data used for its estimates and it does not allow the senior management to be informed about the performance of the rating process. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Articles 76 and 78 of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 15 and 16 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O3","The Supervised Entity shall ensure that the data quality framework provides a full coverage of all layers of the IRB data chain end-to-end. It shall put in place formal controls to ensure that the data quality team analyses the results of the controls envisaged by the data quality framework without relying on manual intervention.

The data quality framework shall be fully documented in internal policies, it shall provide a full and clear understanding of the monitoring of the data used for IRB purposes to be shared with senior management through high level data quality reports.

Additionally, the Supervised Entity shall ensure that the periodic data quality analyses include also a monitoring of the LGD portfolio; it shall define business metrics and data quality standards to apply thresholds/tolerance levels for the executions of the controls in place and it shall define a formalised data ownership along the IRB data chain.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. Deverá ser incluida na decisão final da IMI de CH","3/17/2021 05:00 PM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 02:31 AM"

245,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","GVM",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","F#4","Insufficiencies regarding the validation framework for PD parameters","O4","The following insufficiencies were identified regarding the validation process of PD parameters:

• whenever the validation team performs a validation exercise of a PD model proposed for material change, in the following recurrent validation exercises the calibration tests presented to the Models Validation and Control Committee are mainly based on the proposed model and not on the model currently in place;

• although the validation framework for the review of estimates describes statistical tests and specifies thresholds that depend on tolerance levels and significance levels, the framework does not prescribe a course of action based on the results of the analysis, specifically delimiting the cases when threshold breaches could lead to the re-development of the model, re-estimation or re-calibration; and
• the Supervised Entity’s framework does not take into consideration the performance of a full review of the rating systems on a regular basis.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since the Supervised Entity does not have in place a robust validation system and it does not ensure a regular review of its estimates. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 11(1)(b) and Article 13(c) of EBA/RTS/2016/03, Paragraph 217(c) and Paragraph 220 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and Paragraph 57(d) of the TRIM Guide.",,,,,,,"The Supervised Entity shall ensure that:
• the parameters used for capital requirements calculation are assessed under the recurrent validation exercises, which shall be performed on an annual basis;
• the validation exercise is performed at least on an annual basis;
• the validation framework prescribes a course of actions based on the tests and analyses outcomes;

• a full review of the rating systems, including qualitative validations by the internal audit function, is performed on a regular basis.","Risco Médio","2/28/2020 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"2º Sponsor: DAI (último bullet)
fechado por mail JST de 9-3-2020","3/31/2020 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","9/20/2024 02:03 AM"

246,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#5","Lack of representativeness analysis regarding securitised loans","O5","The Supervised Entity uses for modelling purposes a subpopulation of securitised loans that were prudentially derecognised and also disregarded from the Supervised Entity’s balance sheet. This leads to an inconsistency between the development and the range of application of the model, which has not been supported by a representativeness analysis.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since the Supervised Entity’s rating system do not comprise all relevant exposures, the input variables it uses do not form a reasonable basis for its predictions nor they are representative of the population of the actual exposures. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 40(2)(a) and (b) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 20, 24, 25 and 31 of EBA/GL/2017/16.",,,,,,,"The Supervised Entity shall assess whether the subpopulation of securitised loans, prudentially derecognised and disregarded from the Supervised Entity’s balance sheet is representative of the application portfolio.

In case of lack of representativeness, the Supervised Entity shall assess its influence on risk quantification and address it through an appropriate adjustment and MoC.","Risco Médio","2/28/2020 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Aguarda confirmação da JST após pedido de informação adicional","9/30/2020 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","9/20/2024 02:02 AM"

247,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#6","Performance measure tests indicate some potential weaknesses of the scoring model

Pursuant to Articles 144(1)(a), 170(3)(b)-(c) and Article 174(a) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, institutions’ rating systems shall provide for a meaningful assessment of obligor and transaction characteristics, meaningful differentiation of risk and accurate and consistent quantitative risk estimates. Moreover, the distribution of exposures and obligors across grades or pools must avoid excessive concentrations and allow the grouping of sufficiently homogeneous exposures. Finally, the input variables must form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions and the model must not have material biases.
The results of granularity and homogeneity tests however revealed the following shortcomings with respect the legal requirement set out for this finding:
• an increase in the concentration of facilities for the three lower risk grades;
• low risk differentiation of the model between some risk grades;
• failure of the homogeneity tests for some variables;
• high correlation levels of some variables and modules.","O6","The Supervised Entity shall:
• demonstrate that all relevant potential risk drivers are analysed in order to ensure a proper risk differentiation and, in particular, homogeneity of risk within the risk grades;

• provide evidence supporting the appropriateness of isolating facilities in specific risk grades in terms of the heterogeneity of those facilities. In case this is not possible, the Supervised Entity shall take adequate actions to ensure sufficient heterogeneity among different risk grades;

• assess whether biases are introduced in the model due to the high levels of correlation between the risk drivers; if this is the case, the Supervised Entity shall revisit its choice of the risk drivers.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. Deverá ser incluida na decisão final da IMI de CH","3/17/2021 05:00 PM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""
20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 02:34 AM"

248,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#7","Inconsistencies in the recalculation of historical default flag and in the use of the institution’s definition of default on the risk quantification phase","O7","The following issues were detected:

• an inconsistency in the recalculation of defaults according to the current Definition of Default (DoD) for the period before 2014, which led to the misclassification of default status of some housing loans that were not being considered as default for modelling purposes. Additionally, no evidence was provided that this was subject to an independent review by internal validation; and

• the Modelling Team applies a concept in the risk parameters quantification phase, which is not used by other units of the Supervised Entity. Under this concept, every facility within the same process (i.e. related with the same collateral) is flagged in default, when one of the facilities has a default trigger active. However this cross default is not coherent with the Supervised Entity’s DoD (based on triggers per facility).

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not ensure an assessment of the accuracy, completeness and appropriateness of the data; and the representativeness of the population of exposures; moreover, it does not meet the requirements for a proper DoD and for validation of estimates. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 11, Articles 44(1)(b) and 45(1)(f) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 28 and 30 of EBA/GL/2017/16.",,,,,,,"The Supervised Entity shall perform an independent review when the historical default flag is recalculated for modelling purposes to replicate the most recent DoD and use its own DoD in the risk quantification ","Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"O GVM emitiu um documento (GVM 062-2020) com um independent review ao reprocessamento do historico da NDoD","9/30/2020 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","9/20/2024 02:02 AM"

249,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#8","Data treatment inconsistencies in the calculation of one-year default rates

The Supervised Entity restricts the one-year default rate calculation to facilities that have an exposure above the defined materiality threshold for retail, considered under the internal DoD. This assumption leads to the exclusion of facilities with credit obligations from the calculation of the one-year default rates.

In addition, for the calculation of the one-year default rates, the Supervised Entity only considers a snapshot at the end of each month to identify facilities in default. This procedure leads to the exclusion of facilities that default and cure in the same month (intra-month defaults).

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not apply correctly the definition of one-year default rate. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 49(2) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 28, 30, 71 and 73 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O8","The Supervised Entity shall include in the calculation of the “one-year default rate”:
- all obligors, with any credit obligation, that fall in the range of application of the PD model, at the beginning of the observation period;

- all intra-month defaults (facilities that default and return to a non-defaulted status in the same month).",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. Deverá ser incluida na decisão final da IMI de CH","3/17/2021 05:00 PM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""
20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 02:36 AM"

250,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#9","Calculation of observed average default rates as a facility weighted average - The Supervised Entity calculates the observed average default rate as a facility-weighted average. It results from the ratio between the sum of every facility that has at least one default event in the 12 months following the observation date and the sum of every facility performing at the observation date. Both sums are made across all years and quarters at once.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not estimate PDs from the long run averages of one-year default rates. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 49(2) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 80 and 81 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O9","The Supervised Entity shall review the calculation of the long run average of default rates.
- It shall use the arithmetic average of one year default rates instead of facility weighted average of default rates.
- It shall ensure that the length of the historical observation period is at least 5 years

- It shall justify and document that the selection of the timeframe and of the methodology used to calculate the long-run average default rate reflects the likely range of variability of default rates.

- It shall justify that the current weighting scheme of historic data increases the representativeness of historic data in order to obtain PD from long run averages of one-year default rates or, if this cannot be demonstrated, revise the weighting scheme in order to obtain PDs that are representative of the long run average of one-year default rates.

Where the Supervised Entity calculates the observed average default rate for retail exposure class as a weighted average of one-year default rate, it shall demonstrate that the more recent data is a better predictor of loss rates. If this cannot be justified, the Supervised Entity shall use a simple average in the calculation of the long-run average of default rates.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. Deverá ser incluida na decisão final da IMI de CH","3/17/2021 05:00 PM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""
20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 02:39 AM"

251,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#10","Insufficient observation period for long-run average default rate of the risk grade applied to the cured segment - The anchor point of the risk grade applied to the cured segment was obtained only with quarterly data from January 2008 to October 2009, not ensuring the use of a minimum historical observation period of 5 years.

252,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#11","Lack of a basis regarding the timeframe selection and the methodology for the long-run average default rate calculation - No duly justification has been documented demonstrating that the selection of the timeframe and of the methodology applied by the Supervised Entity to calculate the long-run average default rate reflects the likely range of variability of default rates. In addition, the Supervised Entity applies the cyclicality weight, which gives a weight of 80% during the anchor point calculation to the default rate obtained from the calibration sample and consequently attributes a higher relevance to the last two years of data available. However, the cyclical weight is not justified and in particular it is not demonstrated that the use of higher weights for more recent data enables a better prediction of loss rates.

It can be highlighted that Banco de Portugal issued a recommendation (IRB/2014/35) to “delete the prospective component of the anchor point calculation” (in practice, the anchor point will be equal to the Central Tendency).

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not justify properly that the PDs are based on the long run averages of one-year default rates and that the use of the weighting scheme ensures a better prediction of default rates and the higher weight applied to the most recent period is appropriate. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 48(c) of the EBA/RTS/2016/03 as well as in Paragraphs 82 to 86 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O9","The Supervised Entity shall review the calculation of the long run average of default rates.
- It shall use the arithmetic average of one year default rates instead of facility weighted average of default rates.
- It shall ensure that the length of the historical observation period is at least 5 years

- It shall justify and document that the selection of the timeframe and of the methodology used to calculate the long-run average default rate reflects the likely range of variability of default rates.

- It shall justify that the current weighting scheme of historic data increases the representativeness of historic data in order to obtain PD from long run averages of one-year default rates or, if this cannot be demonstrated, revise the weighting scheme in order to obtain PDs that are representative of the long run average of one-year default rates.

Where the Supervised Entity calculates the observed average default rate for retail exposure class as a weighted average of one-year default rate, it shall demonstrate that the more recent data is a better predictor of loss rates. If this cannot be justified, the Supervised Entity shall use a simple average in the calculation of the long-run average of default rates.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Implementação condicionada à avaliação do 1º exercicio do plano IRB cf. mail JST de 9-3-2020.novobanco considerou a obligation closed no status reporte de 17/3/2021 sem que tivesse tido qq retorno da JST. 253,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#12","Lack of analysis supporting the calibration sample selection

The Supervised Entity selected a calibration sample for the PD model with 8 observation periods (first month of each quarter of 2008 and 2009). No comparative analysis to the current application portfolio in terms of facility characteristics was performed, nor was it assessed if the calibration is representative of the likely range of variability of default rates.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not ensure and justify that the data period used for quantification provide with accuracy and robustness in the estimates. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraphs 88 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O10","The Supervised Entity shall demonstrate that the calibration sample considered for risk quantification purposes is representative of the likely range of variability of the one-year default rate and of the application portfolio in terms of obligor and transaction characteristics.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/28/2020 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Aguarda confirmação da JST após inspeção ","3/17/2021 12:00 AM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""

254,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","13","Incompleteness of the calibration exercise documentation regarding methodological choices
The calibration exercise documentation provided by the Supervised Entity is not complete and lacks the description of critical assumptions made in the calibration exercise, the main ones being:
• the rationale for the selection of the cyclical weight value;
• the description of the selection process for the number of buckets, including the traceability of the sequential steps applied to achieve the final number of buckets;
• the initial values and restrictions considered for the optimization of the calibration curve parameters;
• the criteria for the definition of the average PD value of each risk grade;
• the reasoning for the exclusion of 0.5% observations in the calibration sample from the curve fitting process.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not provide a complete and detailed documentation of the rating system and it does not justify the weighting scheme applied to the historic data. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 32 and Article 50(c) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 72, 81, 88 and 97 of EBA/GL/2017/16.
fechado por mail JST de 9-3-2020","O11","The Supervised Entity shall enrich the calibration exercise documentation and describe the main assumptions made, among which in particular:
• the rationale for the selection of the cyclical weight value;
• the description of the selection process of the number of buckets;
• the initial values and restrictions considered for the optimization of the parameters of the calibration curve;
• the criteria for the definition of the average PD value of each risk grade;

• the reasoning for the exclusion of some observations from the calibration sample for the curve fitting process.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/28/2020 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Tem uma recomendação","3/17/2021 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 04:26 AM"
255,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","F#14","Absence of MoC for PD

The Supervised Entity neither applies a Margin of Conservatism (MoC) for PD nor has a formal MoC framework in place, including formalised procedures for the application of additional conservatism, in case of identification of deficiencies related to the PD estimation. Moreover, it does not quantify a MoC for the general estimation error.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not add a margin of conservatism to its estimates. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 47 of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 36 to 52 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O12","The Supervised Entity shall implement a formal MoC framework for the PD models. This framework shall in particular formalise the procedures for the application of additional conservatism as well as the rules for the quantification of the general estimation error.

Recommendations 1: When defining a framework for MoC the Supervised Entities should be mindful of the regulatory developments included in the EBA/GL/2017/16",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Foi produzido um novo framework de calibração onde este tema é endereçado","3/17/2021 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 06:09 AM"

257,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","F#16"," Lack of a formal validation of the LGD estimates proposed for material changes","O13","The Supervised Entity shall ensure that it submits reports of the Supervised Entity’s independent review or validation of the final version of the proposed model when submitting the application for extensions and changes to the IRB approach classified as requiring competent authorities’ approval.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","8/30/2019 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"12/31/2019 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","9/19/2024 08:32 AM"

260,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#19","Inconsistencies in the EAD -The EAD used to calculate the realised LGD and LGD for defaulted exposures of each defaulted facility is not assured to be equal to the outstanding amount at the default date, since:
• it is calculated by the sum of only principal and past due interests, i.e., fees are excluded;
• there are only end-of-month snapshots, thus the EAD is the exposure at the end of the previous month;
• for the defaults of 2010, there are only quarterly snapshots, thus the EAD is the exposure at the closest date available, which can be before or after the default; and
• due to databases’ reconciliation issues, the principal amount at date of default is missing for some defaults.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not include unpaid late fees in its measure of EAD. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 51(g) of EBA/RTS/2016/03 and in Paragraphs 132 and 137 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O15","The Supervised Entity shall amend the calculation of the EAD to address in particular the following inconsistencies:
• the exclusion of fees;
• the exclusive use of end-of-month exposures;
• the use of quarterly snapshots for defaults of 2010;

• the values of the principal amount at default date for the defaults for which it is missing.",,,,,,,,"Risco Alto","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"3/17/2021 12:00 AM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""

261,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#20","Erroneous risk drivers design and calculation -• The definition of the risk drivers proposed by the Supervised Entity is not clearly specified in terms of reference date, not being possible to fully understand the meaning of the risk drivers proposed.

• Moreover, both the calculation of the Loan-to-Value (LTV) and restructuring flag risk drivers used for the estimation of LGD are based on information not only from before the moment of default but also from after the moment of default. Such erroneous design resulted in the allocation of facilities with very different loss profiles into the same pools posing into question the accuracy of the estimates. In particular, this inconsistency led to a misclassification of secured/unsecured facilities as in the RDS there are defaulted facilities classified as secured without collateral at the date of default.

• In addition, the usage of information observed after the moment of default in the LGD estimation is also inconsistent with the application of the LGD estimates since at their application only information from before the moment of default is available.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its rating system does not provide for a meaningful assessment of obligor and transaction characteristics, its input variables do not form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions and its estimates do not incorporate all relevant data, information and methods. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraphs 122 and 123 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraph 49 of the TRIM Guide.","O16","The Supervised Entity shall define clear rules for the selection and definition of risk drivers, namely in terms of reference date and consistency between the estimation and the application of the LGD, ELBE and LGD in-default estimates.

In addition, the Supervised Entity shall review the allocation of facilities to pools, as defaulted facilities without collateral at the reference date shall not be classified as secured for modelling purposes.",,,,,,,,"Risco Alto","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"3/17/2021 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 06:18 AM"

262,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#21","Incorrect treatment of restructured loans -Several flaws were identified in the treatment of restructured facilities:
• not all defaulted facilities with “restructuring” recovery cash flows are flagged as restructured;

• for the cases where the direct link between the restructured and the restructuring facilities is known and the restructuring facility defaults during the year after the restructuring event, this post-restructuring default is excluded from the RDS together with all of its recoveries. This means that the recoveries of the restructuring facility (which defaulted) are not mapped to the restructured facility and, in case the restructured facility has returned to a non-defaulted status, the artificial cash flow calculated before is not disregarded;

• the proxy used by the Supervised Entity to identify restructured facilities linked to the restructuring ones does not ensure that the restructured facilities are indeed identified. Moreover, it led to the exclusion of 683 defaults from the final RDS, regardless of their status, date or amount;

• when there is a restructuring event with more than one restructuring facility (and just one restructured), the 12 month probation period is only applied to one of the restructuring facilities, since the remaining are excluded;
• finally, the documentation about the restructured facilities treatment is incorrect, not describing what is effectively performed.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its rating system does not provide for a meaningful assessment of obligor and transaction characteristics, its input variables do not form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions and its estimates do not incorporate all relevant data, information and methods. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraph 136 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraph 41 of the TRIM Guide.","O17","The Supervised Entity shall revise and correctly document the treatment of restructured facilities, in particular the rules and proxies considered to identify restructured and restructuring facilities. All defaulted facilities with restructuring recovery cash flows shall be flagged as restructured.",,,,,,,,"Risco Alto","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Foi criação do grupo de reestruturação implementado no âmbito do nDoD","3/17/2021 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 06:21 AM"

263,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#22","Inconsistencies in the calculation of the haircut -The following inconsistencies were identified in the haircut calculation methodology:

• the sample used for the estimation of the haircut only considers information regarding immovable properties sold by the Supervised Entity. No information regarding immovable properties still held by the Supervised Entity is considered;
• the haircut ratio takes into consideration the market value of the properties, instead of the foreclosure value;
• the time necessary to ensure the sale of the properties is not taken into consideration; and
• no justification is presented to justify the use of a different discount rate for the purpose of the haircut’s estimation.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its input variables do not form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraph 117(c) of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O18","The Supervised Entity shall revise the haircut calculation, ensuring in particular that:
• information on immovable properties still held by the institution is considered in the haircut estimation;
• the foreclosure value is used in the haircut estimation, otherwise a clear justification shall be presented to justify the use of a different proxy;
• the time necessary to ensure the sale of the property is taken into consideration;

• the discount rate is consistent with the one applied for the purposes of LGD, ELBE and LGD in-default modelling.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"9/30/2020 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 06:24 AM"

264,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#23","Discount rate approach not aligned with the EBA GL -For the discount of the recovery flows, the Supervised Entity considers the Weighted Average of Cost of Capital instead of using a primary interbank rate applicable at the moment of default increased by an add-on of 5%.","REC#03","Recommendations 3: The Supervised Entities should be mindful of the regulatory developments about discount rates to be applied for calculation of realised LGDs included in the EBA/GL/2017/16.","1",,,"1",,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"É uma recomendação no quadro das novas GL

265,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#24","Inconsistencies in the calculation of the cost rate -The following inconsistencies were identified in the calculation of the cost rate:

• the costs of 2016 were considered in the calculation of the cost rate as a proxy for the average annual costs observed in the time-frame 2010-2016, without any supporting evidence for their adequacy;

• the cost rate is assumed to be the same for all defaulted facilities, independently of the costs incurred with their recovery, e.g. legal costs are allocated to all facilities regardless of a litigation recovery being observed;

• the recovery profile considered to calculate the average annual recoveries does not match with the recovery profile of the LGD model, which, according to the Supervised Entity, is the one used for IFRS 9 purposes;
• not all costs were considered, e.g. IT costs;
• the Supervised Entity has not detailed the reasons to apply the cost rate to the recovery rates.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding since it does not ensure that the realised LGDs reflect economic loss including material discount effects and its input variables do not form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraph 132(a) and Paragraph 144 of EBA/GL/2017/16.","O19","The Supervised Entity shall revise the cost rate calculation, ensuring that:
• proxies considered for the cost rate calculation, as well as exclusion of specific costs, are adequately justified;
• the costs are allocated to the facilities in accordance with the incurred costs (e.g. foreclosure costs allocated only to foreclosed facilities);
• the assumptions applied in the cost rate calculation are aligned with the assumptions of the LGD, ELBE and LGD in-default parameters (e.g. recovery profile);
• all costs are considered.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"3/17/2021 12:00 AM","Apresentação: "" GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""

266,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#25","Incorrect realised LGD -The following inconsistencies were identified in the calculation of the realised LGD and LGD for defaulted exposures:
• the Supervised Entity does not calculate the realised loss at facility level, despite having all the necessary information;
• unaccounted balance sheet components (e.g. price deposit) due to foreclosures of collaterals are being considered as recoveries;
• there are recovery cash flows that are duplicated in the final RDS due to an inaccurate link between tables;
• when several facilities are secured by the same collateral, the non-accounted recoveries are allocated manually and without proportionality, distorting the recovery rate per facility;

• when there is a reversal of a previous foreclosure, the recovery rate is calculated as if it were a foreclosure (with a negative recovery value). In these cases, the date of returning to a non-defaulted status of the first default (as a consequence of a foreclosure) is not disregarded as it should be;

• for closed cases, the recoveries observed after the date of return to non-defaulted status are being used and anticipated to that date without any discount effect. As a consequence, the total recovery is always higher than it should be;
• for the cases where an end-state of closure is considered, the recoveries observed after the date of the end-state are anticipated to that date without any discount effect;

• the recovery cash flows calculated through exposure tracking procedure distort the recovery profile and, consequently, the average recovery rates per bucket, for some of the defaults of 2010, since the “exposure tracking” is not prepared to capture quarterly variations;

• the artificial cash flow is calculated as the difference between the outstanding amount at the default date and the observed recoveries, instead of the outstanding amount at the date of returning to non-defaulted status.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding since it does not apply the correct definitions of loss and it does not estimate LGDs by facility on the basis of average realised LGDs by facility grade and on the basis of all observed defaults. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraphs 131, 132 and 135 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraph 37 of the TRIM Guide.","O20","The Supervised Entity shall calculate the realised loss at facility level and shall consider only recoveries realised during the time in default, discounted based on the effective date of recovery. In addition, the Supervised Entity shall improve the data quality procedures ensuring the adequacy of the realised LGD and LGD in-default.",,,,,,,,"Risco Alto","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"3/17/2021 12:00 AM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""
20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","11/20/2023 06:40 AM"

267,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#27"," -• The LGD pools (which are also used for ELBE and LGD in-default) were chosen based on expert judgment, without any supporting analysis or evidence that other pools had been tested, despite the high concentration in only three pools;
• the homogeneity and heterogeneity of the pools proposed by the Supervised Entity for the LGD model are not ensured nor demonstrated;
• no evidence was provided by the Supervised Entity that all relevant potential risk drivers were analysed to ensure an effective risk differentiation;
• finally, the Supervised Entity did not analyse risk drivers at least within a year before default, but only at the moment of default.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its rating system does not provide a meaningful differentiation of risk; moreover, the distribution of exposures across grades and pools does not manage to avoid excessive concentration and to achieve the grouping of sufficiently homogeneous exposures. Additionally, the Supervised Entity does not fully ensure that the estimates are based on the material drivers of the parameter. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraphs 121 and 122 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraph 47 of the TRIM Guide.","O22","The Supervised Entity shall have a framework in place (e.g. requiring a final completeness check by its Internal Audit function) to ensure that only complete packages are submitted when it applies for a material model change/extension.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","8/30/2019 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Email para JST a 26/03/2019
fechado por mail JST de 9-3-2020","3/17/2021 12:00 AM","20210317_TRIM_Followup_Findings_Obligations","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","9/19/2024 08:32 AM"

268,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#27"," -Unjustifiable exclusions from the RDS were performed, namely:
• defaults with missing obligor ID, since this is not a key variable for the housing loans LGD model;
• defaults occurred before 2010, meaning that not all available defaults are considered and therefore the historical observation period is not as broad as possible.

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its rating system does not provide a meaningful assessment of obligor and transaction characteristics; moreover, it does not ensure that the data used to build the model is representative of the Supervised Entity’s actual exposures, that the Supervised Entity’s estimates incorporate all relevant data and information and that LGD estimates use all observed defaults within the data sources. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Article 51(c) of EBA/RTS/2016/03, in Paragraphs 107, 147 and 154 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraphs 35 and 54 of the TRIM Guide.","O22","The Supervised Entity shall provide evidence supporting the selection of the LGD pools, it shall ensure the homogeneity and heterogeneity of the pools proposed and it shall demonstrate that all relevant potential risk drivers are analysed in order to ensure a proper risk differentiation. Also risk drivers from after the moment of default and up to the date of closure of the recovery process (and in particular realised recoveries) shall be analysed.
This analysis should be performed also for the ELBE and LGD in-default.

Recommendations 4: When performing its LGD segmentation, the Supervised Entity should analyse the risk drivers not only at the moment of default but also at least within a year before default in order to ensure that the reference date used for a risk driver is representative of the realisations of the risk driver within a year before default, being mindful of the regulatory developments such as EBA/GL/2017/16.",,,,,,,,"Risco Alto","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"Tem uma recomendação.

270,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#29"," -The Supervised Entity projects recoveries for incomplete processes which have been in default since more than 6 years without providing any supporting evidence based on factual recoveries observed during similar period of time on similar credit facilities.
Moreover, the treatment applied by the Supervised Entity led to:
i) total nominal recovery rate greater than 100% for the end-state “Open” for some pools;

ii) total nominal recovery rate of end-state “Open” is greater than the total nominal recovery rate of the “Foreclosure” end-state for all pools, meaning that the total nominal recovery of credit facilities recovered by means of collateral in the first 6 years is lower than the total nominal recovery of credit facilities recovered by means of collateral after the 6 years; this is an indication of excessive optimism, without any justification or rationale being presented by the Supervised Entity.

Additionally, the Supervised Entity did not demonstrate the adequacy of the average recovery rate observed for the “Foreclosure” end-state as a proxy for the expected recovery rate of the cases still open after 6 years in default which is expected to be realised mostly through the courts (litigation).

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since its rating system does not provide accurate and consistent quantitative estimates of risk and it does not ensure that the estimates are plausible and intuitive. This understanding of the ECB is also reflected in Paragraphs 153, 154 and 158 of EBA/GL/2017/16 and in Paragraph 60 of the TRIM Guide.","O24","The Supervised Entity shall use data to support the selection of the time-to-workout and not base it exclusively on expert judgment.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","2/25/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,,"3/17/2021 12:00 AM","Apresentação: ""GVM 092_2020_IRB_CH_Comportamental_ Valid_Inicial_v02""

272,"TRIM-HDP-3252/2017","2/25/2019 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRG",,,"IRB",,"Crédito Habitação","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F#31"," -The methodology to calculate the long run average LGD and LGD for defaulted exposures proposed by the Supervised Entity presents several flaws:
• no discounting effects are applied to the artificial cash flow of a credit facility, as well as to all the recoveries of that credit facility assigned to the same time bucket;
• the discounting of the recoveries is only performed after their aggregation by time-bucket and assuming the midpoint of the bucket as a proxy for recoveries date;
• no zero floor is applied to the realised LGD at facility level for the purposes of long run average calculation (5% of the defaulted facilities have negative realised LGD).

According to the understanding of the ECB, the Supervised Entity does not fulfil the legal requirements set out in this finding, since it does not meet the requirements set for LGD estimation. 280,"ECB-SSM-2021-PTNOB-7 / TRIM 3974","6/9/2021 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB",,"Grandes Empresas e Institucionais","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","F1","Shortcomings in the use of ECAI external ratings in lieu of internal ratings

The Supervised Entity uses ECAI external ratings, instead of internally calculated ones in instances when the Supervised Entity does not have better information about a corporation than the ECAI (i.e. when the input data -annual financial statements- is not available). The Supervised Entity stated that external ratings are only used for foreign corporations with no credit exposure, in the context of parent support for subsidiaries. 281,"ECB-SSM-2021-PTNOB-7 / TRIM 3974","6/9/2021 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB",,"Grandes Empresas e Institucionais","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","F2","Missing calculation of individual ratings
The Supervised Entity does not always calculate the stand-alone rating for each obligor, but rather assigns the group rating directly to the individual obligor. This practice is due at least to:

a) An inappropriate rating assignment process, which permits to assign the group rating directly to the individual obligor, instead of using an economic sector activity template to compute the stand-alone rating of an obligor. In addition, in case of a rating transferred from a third party to an obligor, there is no sufficient evidence that the characteristics of the specific obligor are properly taken into account or that an appropriate guarantee exists.

b) If no “pro-forma” consolidated financial statement has been derived, the group rating to which the obligor belongs may also be assigned, directly through the use of the Parent - Subsidiary template. The Supervised Entity is assigning to the obligor the rating of the third party while there is no appropriate guarantee and it is not clear that the characteristics of the specific obligor are well taken into account. It is the understanding of the ECB that the Supervised Entity does not meet the legal requirements as laid down for this finding since it does not ensure that the input variables form a reasonable and effective basis for the resulting predictions and that the risk parameter PD incorporates all relevant data, information and methods. The understanding of the ECB is also reflected in paragraphs 62 and 63 of the EBA/GL/2017/167.","O2","The Supervised Entity shall analyse whether also other relevant obligor and transaction risk characteristics than the third party rating should be properly reflected in the model and that no material biases are introduced by unwarranted weight levels of the internal rating information.",,,,,,"For the purposes of performing rating transfers in the context of economic groups, the Supervised Entity is recommended to be mindful of paragraph 62 (a) of the EBA/GL/2017/16 and ensure that there is an appropriate guarantee and the rating of a third party is assigned internally in accordance with the rating system for which the institution has received permission in accordance with Article 143(2) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.",,"Risco Médio","12/10/2021 04:00 PM","Final",,"Concluída",,"(conforme doc IRB meeting de 21/02/2022)","3/31/2022 12:00 AM","20230331_TRIM-2018-PTNOB-3974_quarter_FollowUp","6/30/2022 06:17 AM","2/13/2025 02:37 AM"

282,"ECB-SSM-2021-PTNOB-7 / TRIM 3974","6/9/2021 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB",,"Grandes Empresas e Institucionais","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","F3","The rating methodology is not justified for emerging market obligors

The rating templates were developed to assess obligors from developed markets. However, for groups which have a significant part of the turnover originated in emerging markets, the Supervised Entity applies the following two approaches:

a) For the calculation of the group (or sub group) rating, the revenues resulting from emerging economies are weighted by the corresponding external country rating (in the “Integrated Company” template). This first approach is set forth in the rating manual.

b) For the calculation of an emerging company rating (always incorporated in a group from a developed economy), the Supervised Entity applies the economic sector activity template, established for developed markets. This second approach is not set forth in the rating manual.

The Supervised Entity did not present any analysis supporting the adequacy of the approaches described above and they are not specifically monitored in the scope of model validation.","O3","The Supervised Entity shall document the internal procedures to assign ratings to groups with revenues resulting from emerging markets or companies in emerging markets (incorporated in groups from developed economies), guaranteeing that they are explicitly reflected in the internal manuals and guides. Moreover, the Supervised Entity shall perform supporting analysis of the adequacy of the applied procedures. 283,"ECB-SSM-2021-PTNOB-7 / TRIM 3974","6/9/2021 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB",,"Grandes Empresas e Institucionais","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","F4","Deficient expert input in the rating assignment process
The rating assignment process is supported by expert input, subject to the following deficiencies:

a) There is no traceability of model template selection; despite being supported with the obligor economic activity code, some instances are ambiguous. There is also evidence of obligors for which the model template has changed over time, without a documented rationale.

b) The rationales and arguments to the scores given within the business risk module and financial flexibility factor are not fully justified, as for instance: i) in some cases there is no justification presented; ii) in other cases the justification is not related with the risk factor to be assessed; and iii) in other cases the justification presented does not allow to justify the selected score.

c) The business risk module scores lack coherence between the group rating and the stand-alone rating, as, in some cases, the individual company is operating in different markets (e.g. countries) and in different economic sectors, but the scores are kept the same as the group, without a clear justification.

d) In the application of the overlay template “Government - Related Entities” the criteria for assigning notches to align - to a full or certain extent - to the sovereign rating are not specified, which may produce inconsistencies in the assignment of ratings among credit analysts.

The instances where the Supervised Entity utilises human judgment to complement the statistical model are not properly documented and do not take into account all relevant information not considered by the model. It is the understanding of the ECB that the Supervised Entity does not meet the legal requirements set forth in this finding as it does not adequately justify its use of expert judgment. This understanding is also reflected in paragraph 202 of the EBA/GL/2017/16.

284,"ECB-SSM-2021-PTNOB-7 / TRIM 3974","6/9/2021 04:00 PM","Supervisor","DRT",,,"IRB",,"Grandes Empresas e Institucionais","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","F5","Compromised integrity of financial ratios due to adjustments
The adjustments made to the financial ratios that are inputs for the rating assignment process, are compromising the integrity of the said financial ratios in the following ways:

a) There is evidence of financial adjustments performed for the group rating, but the same applicable adjustment is not made in the ratios that are input to the stand-alone rating of the obligor. This practice may produce wrong results for the stand-alone rating, which may compromise the validation performed on the ratings.

b) In selected cases, the derivation of financial indices from financial ratios and the related inputs in the annual financial report, and sector-specific adjustments, is not sufficiently explained, justified and detailed, which raises concerns on the capability of its effective replication by a third person.

c) The calculation of financial ratios and all its needed adjustments are being performed in excel files, which may affect the traceability of the financial rating inputs and attributed scores. In selected cases, there is evidence of more than one excel file being applied to obtain the final financial ratios.

We understand there is a new excel file with the adjustments to the financial ratios, which needs to be stored in a specific place (gedoc). This should address point c). a)
column2: Related to paragraph a) it was clarified in “Manual de Processos e Procedimentos” that the adjustments done at subsidiary and at group level should always be documented mainly when this modify substantially the reported accounts.

column1: b)
column2: To improve the traceability of the adjustments done by the analysts in the financial information provided for the client two new Excel Models were developed (sent in attachment). The File “Modelo contas v5.1.xlsx” has 3 new sheets that allow to (i) import the information from the financial accounts stored in “Aplicação de Balanços” (sheet “Aplicação de Balanços”) in which can be seen the reported accounts without any adjustment, (ii) understand the difference between the reported EBITDA and the Adjusted EBITDA (Sheet “Reconciliação de EBITDA”) and (iii) understand the difference between the reported DEBT and the Adjusted DEBT (“Reconciliação de Dívida”). These indicators were chosen to a more detailed discrimination of each adjustment because are those with more impact in the majority of the Credit Risk Indicators that influence the final rating. The adjustments on the other indicators are done in the sheet “Ajust, Indic. Template” in the corresponding line named “ajustamento analista”. When some adjustment are done on this sheet, the analyst will make a comment/note justifying the given adjustment so it can be still traceable. The second Excel model, “Modelo contas v5.0.xlsx”, allows the manual input of the reported financial information by the analyst and should be used when the historical information is not available in the Bank’s systems or other cases in which is not appropriate to use those accounts. This Excel model continues to have the breakdown of all the adjustments done on EBITDA and Debt, as stated previously. In the written analysis, the analyst will also copy the tables with the EBITDA and Debt adjustments at Group level. These Excel models will start to be applied during June 2022.

column1: c)
column2: The corresponding Excel files will continue to be stored in a specific place (gedoc).
