659,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","1","The Supervised Entity considers the existence of a guarantor as a risk driver, presenting in this case estimates that produce a lower risk weight than the risk weight that would apply to an otherwise identical exposure in respect of which the institution has no unfunded credit protection. However, the Supervised Entity does not ensure the final risk weight is not lower than the risk weight of a comparable direct exposure to the guarantor. As of June 2023, and December 2023, the supervised Entity was not applying the supervisory multiplier factor of 1.29, resulting from ECB decision ECB-SSM-2022-PTNOB-2, to the RWA of unscored exposures in the scope of the PD origination model of the residential mortgage loans.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Baixo","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP.",,,"9/24/2024 03:41 AM","3/25/2025 08:43 AM"

660,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","DDA","DDA-IG",,"IRB","PD e LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Processo","2","The current status of the implementation plans for PD and LGD material model changes does not ensure that the Supervised Entity is able to fully replicate the execution of the models and the calculation of own funds requirements according to the model change in a non-live production environment. In particular, implementation tests of the models in the IT systems have not been performed.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP",,,"9/24/2024 03:45 AM","3/25/2025 08:41 AM"

661,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","DDA","DDA-GQD",,"IRB","Todos Parâmetros","N/A","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Data Quality","3","The Data Quality Process for IRB purposes is not effectively implemented through the IRB data chain, from an end-to-end perspective, according to the following:
• There are insufficient data quality controls in critical data elements.
• The framework does not allow a comprehensive coverage of the IRB process, as the RDS data quality process is not being performed according to the data quality framework defined.
• Most data sources used to gather model inputs are still not fully certified as golden sources.
• The data quality reports on model inputs do not reflect a complete data quality assessment.
In particular, the data quality reports performed in the scope of the development of mortgages LGD, presents the following limitations:

• Lack of controls in the exercise performed by the Data Governance and Quality team, hinders the overall assessment of the data appropriateness, as only 59% of the critical data elements used by the LGD model are covered, with insufficient controls over critical data elements such as loan-to-value, existence of guarantor flag and existence of a litigation process flag. The executed controls do not ensure the accuracy and consistency of data, and no business metrics were defined.

• Lack of effectiveness of the data quality exercise performed by the DGQ team, since: (i) data quality issues identified by the development team in key risk drivers were not detected by the DGQ data quality exercise; and (ii) moderate severity exceptions on data elements that are not scope of the mortgage LGD model are reported. The data quality exercise performed at the LGD RDS layer by the model development unit triggered a significant number of data treatments and corrections, without an upstream investigation of potential root causes, and analysis of all remediation options that should have been considered and documented as part of the decision process that led to the implementation of such treatments and corrections in the construction of the RDS.","1","The Supervised Entity shall ensure that the data quality framework is effectively implemented through the IRB data chain, from an end-to-end perspective, i.e. from the source systems to the RDS data.

Moreover, the Supervised Entity shall ensure effective data quality controls in critical data elements and shall ensure accuracy and consistency of all data used for IRB purposes. The data quality reports on model inputs for the development of IRB models shall reflect a complete and appropriate data quality assessment, with effective data quality controls over critical data elements. The executed controls shall ensure the accuracy and consistency of data, and business controls shall be defined and implemented.
The Supervised Entity shall use data certified in the data quality framework, namely from the Golden Source.

The Supervised Entity shall ensure that data quality issues identified in the construction of the RDS have an upstream investigation of potential root causes, including analysis and documentation of remediation options.","4","3",,"1",,,,"Risco Alto","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 03:55 AM","3/25/2025 08:46 AM"

662,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Crédito Habitação Originação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","4","The following decisions, based on expert judgment in the development process of the mortgage origination scoring model under review, have not been properly justified, documented, or their effect on risk differentiation analysed by the Supervised Entity:
• Forcing the monotonicity of the default rate to obtain a decreasing trend with increasing age.

• The override of the weight of the age variable in the sociodemographic module, in order to force its entry into the model, which had been excluded in the logistic regression, given its low capacity to discriminate risk.
• The maintenance of variables with high correlation in the model based on the sole argument that this situation had already been verified in the 2011 fine-tuning of the model.
,2","The Supervised Entity shall properly justify, document and analyse the impact of the use of human judgment in the development of the ranking-scoring methods.
The Supervised Entity shall perform a clear and complete analysis whether data used to develop the model is representative of the application portfolio.
The Supervised Entity shall perform homogeneity tests with criteria-based subpopulations.

The Supervised Entity shall ensure heterogeneity across all risk grades for existing and new clients segments. Additionally, the Supervised Entity shall ensure that the model, in particular the new clients model, has a meaningful risk differentiation and discriminatory power.

Furthermore, the Supervised Entity shall properly document their analysis in order to allow for a third-party to replicate the process.","5",,"3","2",,,,"Risco Médio","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:00 AM","3/25/2025 08:58 AM"

663,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Crédito Habitação Originação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","5","The following weaknesses were identified related with the structure of the PD models:
• The homogeneity tests performed by the Supervised Entity are insufficient because are only based on random sampling within each grade and no criteria-based subpopulations are considered.
• Heterogeneity is not ensured for some grades of the existing clients (1-2, 2-3, 4-5) and the new clients segment (1-2, 2-3, 3-4).

• A meaningful differentiation of risk is not ensured as the discriminatory power is very low for the new clients segment (AUC of 67.4% for sample with Junes and Decembers from 2011 to 2020, which corresponds to a powerstat of 34.9%).

Furthermore, the documentation is insufficient to allow for a third-party to replicate the homogeneity analysis and contains inconsistencies regarding what was actually performed.","2","The Supervised Entity shall properly justify, document and analyse the impact of the use of human judgment in the development of the ranking-scoring methods.
The Supervised Entity shall perform a clear and complete analysis whether data used to develop the model is representative of the application portfolio.
The Supervised Entity shall perform homogeneity tests with criteria-based subpopulations.

The Supervised Entity shall ensure heterogeneity across all risk grades for existing and new clients segments. Additionally, the Supervised Entity shall ensure that the model, in particular the new clients model, has a meaningful risk differentiation and discriminatory power.

Furthermore, the Supervised Entity shall properly document their analysis in order to allow for a third-party to replicate the process.","5",,"3","2",,,,"Risco Médio","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:03 AM","3/25/2025 09:31 AM"

664,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Crédito Habitação Originação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","7","The following shortcomings were identified in the MoC quantification:
• Although the calibration exercise documentation states that an upper limit at a 90% confidence interval is used, the Supervised Entity considered a 95% confidence interval.

• The analysis of a MoC A to capture intra-month defaults (trigger T01) is flawed, as it relies on the conclusions of a period where no default was flagged through this trigger. The analysis was performed over a very small period (5 months), which is deemed insufficient, and there is no evidence of ongoing monitoring.

• The Supervised Entity presents several approaches to calculate MoC C but there is no support for the approach selected. Moreover, the MoC C approach applied does not take into consideration the dependency between default rates over time nor does it account for the fact that the uncertainty associated with the general estimation error is primarily driven by the statistical uncertainty of each ODR and the length of the time series.","3","The Supervised Entities shall implement a margin of conservatism to address the issues identified in relation to the MoC C estimation.

At a minimum, the increase in MoC shall cover the underestimation quantified during the investigation as set out in the Assessment Report. Any additional uncertainties identified in the remediation process should be treated with additional margin of conservatism and this shall be clearly documented.","1",,"1",,,,,"Risco Médio","6/24/2025 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:05 AM","3/25/2025 09:34 AM"

665,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Crédito Habitação Originação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","7","The following shortcomings were identified in the MoC quantification:
• Although the calibration exercise documentation states that an upper limit at a 90% confidence interval is used, the Supervised Entity considered a 95% confidence interval.

• The analysis of a MoC A to capture intra-month defaults (trigger T01) is flawed, as it relies on the conclusions of a period where no default was flagged through this trigger. The analysis was performed over a very small period (5 months), which is deemed insufficient, and there is no evidence of ongoing monitoring.

• The Supervised Entity presents several approaches to calculate MoC C but there is no support for the approach selected. Moreover, the MoC C approach applied does not take into consideration the dependency between default rates over time nor does it account for the fact that the uncertainty associated with the general estimation error is primarily driven by the statistical uncertainty of each ODR and the length of the time series.","4","The Supervised Entity shall consistently apply the internally defined MoC framework, properly justifying and documenting the selected approaches.

Moreover, the Supervised Entity shall regularly monitor the levels of MoC applied, confirming that the levels of MoC defined are still adequate considering the most recent information available. In particular, the analysis of a MoC A to capture intra-month defaults shall be better supported.

Furthermore, the Supervised Entity shall properly justify the methodology used to calculate MoC C and shall ensure that the chosen approach takes into consideration the dependency between default rates over time and the fact that the uncertainty associated with the general estimation error is primarily driven by the statistical uncertainty of each ODR and the length of the time series.","3",,"1","2",,,,"Risco Alto","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:09 AM","3/25/2025 09:35 AM"

666,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,"DDA","IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Data Quality","8","According to Article 5(2) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, ‘loss’ means economic loss, including material discount effects, and material direct and indirect costs associated with collecting on the instrument while according to Article 181(1) (e), (h) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, institutions shall ensure that LGD estimates are not solely based on the market value of collateral but also consider potential delays in gaining control of it and liquidating it. For exposures already in default, institutions must account for both the best estimate of expected loss based on current economic conditions and exposure status, as well as the potential increase in loss rates due to unexpected additional losses incurred during the recovery period, from the date of default to the final liquidation of the exposure. The Supervised Entity is increasing the denominator of the ratio of the economic loss to the outstanding amount of the credit obligation at the moment of default by the value of additional drawings, despite not including additional drawings in their conversion factors for this portfolio (5,294 defaults, 11.1% of the RDS). Moreover, there are additional drawings that are not observed as releases of capital, but instead are a result of data quality problems. The Supervised Entity does not apply the multiple defaults treatment after extending the default event with the restructuring facilities (68 defaults, 0.1% of the RDS). In the treatment of restructured facilities, some links were not properly identified due to an operational error of the development team (44 defaults, 0.1% of the RDS). The haircut for repossessed collaterals estimation process (affects 419 defaults, 0.9% of the RDS) presents the following shortcomings:

• Haircuts are estimated at facility level, rather than at collateral level, which can bias the estimation, as the same haircut value can be repeated through the estimation sample as many times as the number of facilities covered by the same collateral.
• The haircut estimation is considering immovable properties that were sold to related entities (real estate funds own by the Supervised Entity).
• The discount rate applied to the sale amount is based on the 3-month EURIBOR at repossession date instead of default date.
• The haircut model documentation is incomplete and does not allow for an independent third-party to replicate the final haircuts. Moreover, some formulas are not consistent with the implementation.

The Supervised Entity estimates a fixed monthly indirect cost amount per facility based on recovery processes of all portfolios and applied it only to the monthly positions when the facilities are in a specific recovery stage, leading to an underestimation of the indirect costs applied. The calculation of the realised LGD presents several shortcomings:

• wrongly identified cures (observed in 2 defaults out of 13 selected cases with return to non-default status) due to: i) exclusion of facilities only with write-off amounts before the treatment of multiple defaults; ii) accrued interests not removed from the databases at settlement date.
• non-observed recovery cash-flows from interest payments inferred from the payment plan were incorrectly considered (observed in 22 defaults out of 30 selected cases).
• incorrect recovery cash-flows stemming from sale of immovable properties to real estate funds owned by the Supervised Entity (130 defaults, 0.3% of the RDS).

• non-observed recovery cash-flows inferred from the “lost cases” treatment (at least 336 defaults identified by the Supervised Entity, 0.7% of the RDS).","5","The Supervised Entity shall ensure consistency in the EAD definition, particularly considering additional drawings after default, between LGD and CCF model estimation. Moreover, the Supervised Entity shall ensure that additional drawings used in LGD estimates are observed releases of capital and not the result of data quality issues.
The Supervised Entity shall ensure an appropriate treatment of multiple defaults, by applying the multiple defaults treatment after extending the default event with the restructuring facilities.
The Supervised Entity shall ensure the traceability between all restructured and restructuring facilities.

The Supervised Entity shall ensure that the haircut for repossessed collaterals estimation process is estimated at facility level and does not consider immovable properties that were sold to real estate funds own by the Supervised Entity. Moreover, the haircut model shall be properly documented in order to allow for an independent third-party to replicate the final haircuts.
The Supervised Entity shall include all observed indirect costs in the cost estimation process and ensure that the costs are applied during the entire recovery period.
The Supervised Entity shall ensure that return to non-default status is properly identified in the calculation of the realised LGD.
The Supervised Entity shall not consider non-observed recovery cash-flows in the calculation of the realised LGD, namely inferred from the payment plan or from the “lost cases” treatment.

The Supervised Entity shall ensure that recovery cash-flows stemming from sale of immovable properties to real estate funds owned by the Supervised Entity are not considered in the calculation of the realised LGD.","9","2","4","3",,,"The Supervised Entity shall apply a multiplication factor of 1.20 (add-on) to its estimates for the LGD for non-defaulted exposures, LGD for defaulted exposures and ELBE of the residential mortgage portfolio under the scope of this Decision.
The add-on shall be applied for the purpose of calculating RWA and expected loss.

This limitation shall apply until the ECB has confirmed in writing that Obligations 5 and 6 have been fulfilled by the Supervised Entity.","Risco Severo","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:13 AM","3/25/2025 09:37 AM"

667,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Processo","9","With regards to the LGD model structure assessment, the following insufficiencies were identified: • Excessive concentration of the application portfolio in the “LTV < 0.5” segment (performing), and in the “TiD ≤ 2 years and LTV < 0.5” segment (nonperforming), which combined with the moderate homogeneity assessment for these segments, suggests that further analysis and risk driver selection would have improved the model’s risk differentiation.

• The risk driver “existence of litigation process” was only considered significant for exposures with LTV equal to or greater than 0.7, while its consideration in lower LTV buckets would have yielded, with sufficient materiality, very distinctive levels of economic loss, in the context of the nonperforming secured model structure.

• The risk driver LTV used for estimation is inconsistently defined across time, as the historical DWH data reflects different exposure definitions for LTV numerator calculation purposes.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP.",,,"9/24/2024 04:16 AM","3/25/2025 09:39 AM"

671,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","13","Article 179(1) (f) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, institutions shall incorporate a margin of conservatism in their estimates, reflecting the expected range of estimation errors. If methods and data are less satisfactory, leading to larger expected range of errors, the margin of conservatism shall be larger. The Supervised Entity did not identify all data and methodology deficiencies, related to the estimation of LGD estimates, that lead to an increased uncertainty and, therefore, should have been assessed under a MoC of categories A and B, namely:
• The data issues that led to inappropriate exclusions of defaults from the RDS (293 defaults, 0.6% of the RDS).
• The algorithm used to obtain cash-flows as the difference between the exposure amounts.
• The inclusion of recoveries according to the payment plan of the facility.
• The treatment of “lost cases” (377 defaults, 0.8% of the RDS).
• The algorithm for the identification of restructuring events.
• The BES resolution and creation of NB in 2014.
Moreover, the quantification of appropriate adjustments (AA) and MoC A presents the following insufficiencies:

• Lack of accuracy in the calculation of the AA for the “insufficiency of default historical information related to restructuring triggers (T06)” (MoC A2) in the downturn LGD, since the adjustment assumes that the additional defaults in the downturn period would have a loss equal to the defaults in 2015-2021 triggered solely by T06 trigger, which may be underestimating the uncertainty of this insufficiency in the downturn period.

• Insufficient analysis in the calculation of an AA for the “Limitation on the identification of the EAD on daily basis for defaults prior to 2020” (MoC A5), as the impact of discounting cash-flows to the exact EAD date was not assessed.
Furthermore, the quantification of AA and MoC B presents the following insufficiencies:

• The methodology to calculate an AA for the potential “lack of representativeness of the NATA massive credit sale to future credit sales” (MoC B1) assumes a higher recovery rate than what was observed, and this assumption is not fully supported nor dully justified.
• The calculation of an AA for the “allocation of the surplus from collateral sales” is not appropriate, as the LGD realised must be calculated at facility default level.

All the previous insufficiencies related with the AA calculation apply to the ELbe estimation, and insufficiencies related with the MoC calculation apply to the LGD in-default estimation.","6","The Supervised Entity shall review its process of identifying the sources of uncertainty during the estimation process of risk parameters to ensure that all required and appropriate Margin of Conservatism adjustments are identified, assessed and quantified in order to obtain the most accurate estimates possible.
Regarding the quantification of identified sources of uncertainty, the Supervised Entity shall:

• Review the methodology to address the “insufficiency of default historical information related to restructuring triggers (T06)” (MoC A2) in the downturn LGD, since the adjustment assumes that the additional defaults in the downturn period would have a loss equal to the defaults in 2015-2021 triggered solely by T06 trigger, which may be underestimating the uncertainty of this insufficiency in the downturn period.

• Review the appropriate adjustment for the potential lack of representativeness of the NATA massive credit sale to future credit sales” (MoC B1), since this assumption is not fully supported nor dully justified.

• Disregard the calculation of an appropriate adjustment and margin of conservatism for the “allocation of the surplus from collateral sales” (MoC B2), as the LGD realised must be calculated at facility default level.","4",,"1","3",,,"The Supervised Entity shall apply a multiplication factor of 1.20 (add-on) to its estimates for the LGD for non-defaulted exposures, LGD for defaulted exposures and ELBE of the residential mortgage portfolio under the scope of this Decision.
The add-on shall be applied for the purpose of calculating RWA and expected loss.

This limitation shall apply until the ECB has confirmed in writing that Obligations 5 and 6 have been fulfilled by the Supervised Entity.","Risco Alto","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:29 AM","3/25/2025 08:50 AM"

672,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Modelo","14","The Supervised Entity estimated the ELbe for the unsecured segment as the long-run average LGD for defaulted exposures without assessing if it reflects current economic conditions. For the low debt segment the Supervised Entity did not set reference dates to be used for grouping defaulted exposures in accordance with the recovery patterns observed, and as such, present a single ELbe estimate to be used for all time in default that is lower than 100% even after the end of the maximum period of the recovery process defined.

The Supervised Entity uses a methodology to calculate the final LGD in-default parameters that originates a cliff effect to the corresponding performing LGD parameter at the moment of default (in case of exposures in the performing segment “LTV ≥ 70% without guarantor”) which is not duly justified. Moreover, there is a lack of hierarchy of LGD in-default and ELbe values that, in some cases, decrease with time in default (for example, from “2 < YiD ≤ 4, LTV ≥ 70%, with litigation” to “4 < YiD ≤ 6, with litigation”), which have no economic meaning and should have been further investigated. Regarding the calculation of the appropriate adjustment to be included in ELbe estimation, the methodology used to assess the insufficiency in indirect costs is not adequate and significantly reduces the scope of indirect costs being considered between the performing and non-performing portfolios. Additionally, the Supervised Entity did not perform back-testing nor benchmarking in the ELbe and LGD in-default estimates.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP.",,,"9/24/2024 04:31 AM","3/25/2025 08:53 AM"

673,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GVM",,,"IRB","PD e LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Documentos","15","The validation framework presents several insufficiencies, namely: • The framework lacks detailed guidance on conducting several types of analyses: For instance, the representativeness analyses are predominantly qualitative, and there is no prescription for specific analyses to assess data quality dimensions. Additionally, the framework does not provide a structured approach for evaluating regulatory compliance, nor does it describe analyses for assessing the CCF MoC.

• The framework lacks thresholds for some quantitative metrics: it only considers a relative threshold to assess the LGD and CCF gAUC and fails to define explicit thresholds to evaluate the discriminatory power for PD LDP initial validations.

• The methodology for assessing grade/segment homogeneity in an initial validation is not robust, as it relies on random sample and does not ensure the test’s purpose. The framework also lacks definitions for homogeneity and heterogeneity analyses in recurrent validations.

• The overall validation process lacks specific guidance on combining different dimensions to reach each parameter’s final assessment. Additionally, the framework does not explicitly specify the actions to be triggered for Amber and Red results, nor does it provide a clear definition of full validation and the frequency at which it should be conducted.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP.",,,"9/24/2024 04:33 AM","3/25/2025 08:55 AM"

674,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431 ","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GVM",,,"IRB","PD e LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Processo","16","The validation exercises performed to the development of the residential mortgage proposed models were deemed insufficient, since not all key aspects of the material changes were fully and critically assessed.
In the validation exercises performed to the scoring model development and PD calibration exercise:

• The validation team did not sufficiently challenge the risk drivers chosen by the development team and did not replicate the bucketing approach, thus not discovering that it had in fact several manual adjustments that were not documented. Also, the homogeneity test performed by GVM is not sufficiently robust, as it relies on random samples and does not pinpoint potentially different risk profiles.

• The validation team suspended their assessment of the fulfilment of several previous validation findings, with the justification that they would be also assessed by the supervisor during this investigation (validation findings #13-#21 and #23).
In the LGD model validation exercise:

• The validation team issued inadequate findings and recommendations, not supported by a regulatory basis or seemingly noncompliant with regulatory requirements, namely, with regards to the inclusion of written-off amounts before or at the date of default, which contradicts paragraph 134 of EBA/GL/2017/16.

• GVM did not issue any recommendation with regards to the high concentration of the application portfolio in the LTV < 0.5 segment, and lack of representativeness of the RDS, despite having detected the issue, performed challengers, and found evidence that the issue could have been addressed with the use of additional risk drivers.
• GVM did not issue a recommendation regarding the LGD downturn estimation, that take into account the higher downturn estimates identified by some challengers performed by GVM.

• GVM identified data quality issues in LTVs calculated during the default period, in 3 out of the 5 facilities individually reviewed in the context of the ELbe validation. This issue resulted in a low severity finding based on the size of the non-performing application portfolio, and no further investigation into potential root causes, and whether these issues might have impacted the performing LGD model.","7","The Validation function of the Supervised Entity shall:
• Critically and independently assess all aspects of the material model changes.
• Independently perform the assessment of the material model changes and of the fulfilment of previous findings.
• Be accurate when issuing findings and recommendations and ensure that those are compliant with regulatory requirements and well supported by a regulatory basis.

• Issue recommendations for all identified issues that could be addressed to improve the development of the models.","4",,"2","2",,,,"Risco Alto","3/24/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso",,,,,"9/24/2024 04:35 AM","3/25/2025 08:56 AM"

675,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","DAI",,,"IRB","PD e LGD","Crédito Habitação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Documentos","17","The assessment performed by the Internal Audit to the recommendations issued to the validation framework is not adequate nor sufficient to ensure that the issues are effectively addressed by the internal validation unit because:

• The Internal Audit concluded that obligation #12 from ECB decision ECB-SSM-2022-PTNOB-8 and obligation #4 from ECB decision ECB-SSM-2023-PTNOB-7 were sufficiently implemented, however, the validation framework still does not fully address the regulatory compliance check nor covers all the required MoC analyses.

• Previous recommendations issued by the Internal Audit were assessed in a latter report as implemented. However, some recommendations from the previous assessment remain unresolved, specifically those related to representativeness analyses, the relative threshold for LGD and CCF discriminatory power, and the explicit definition of a full validation.

Furthermore, there is no clear and final assessment to the validation framework from DAI, as the global assessment is “not rated” and the conclusions of the recommendations’ assessment only commit to a minimum acceptable of compliance.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(25/03/2025) - Deadline de 31/12/2027 alinhado com o IRB OP.",,,"9/24/2024 04:38 AM","3/25/2025 08:58 AM"

(Jun 24)","6/30/2024 12:00 AM","Auditor Externo","DRG","DRG Monitorização e Controlo do Risco de Crédito",,"IFRS9",,"N/A","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","A.14","Incorporação de eventos subsequentes.
Inexistência de um processo que permita assegurar a incorporação da totalidade dos eventos subsequentes nas análises individuais.
Todos os eventos materialmente relevantes que confirmem as condições existentes à data de reporte e que ocorram até à data de aprovação das contas, deverão ser considerados pelo analista.

,A.14","Recomendamos a implementação de um processo robusto que garanta que todos os eventos subsequentes que dão lugar a ajustamentos nas Demonstrações Financeiras são devidamente considerados.","1",,"1",,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2024 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Validação Detetor","4224000000706","(31/12/2024) - Conforme já tínhamos alertado anteriormente este ponto não deveria ser considerado uma deficiência dado o Banco ter agido nos tempos devidos, damos recentemente como exemplo o fato da EY querer que o NB fizesse 100% de imparidade na Inapa (+1M€), sendo que como veio a acontecer agora em Dezembro a Inapa vendeu um ativo e conseguiu pagar 6,5M€ da exposição do banco.  Em 29/11/2024, a Inapa France foi vendida por 25M€ à JPP e o Sr AI distribuiu aos credores pignoratícios das suas ações a quota parte. O NB recebeu 6,750M€, 90% do valor da sua quota parte de ações empenhadas (30%) em 04/12/2024, considerando esta recuperação resulta numa reversão no valor de 6,75 M€. Pedimos o fecho deste finding dado termos vindo a incorporar os eventos subsequentes em todos os casos.
Recordatório - Justificação dada para a imparidade junho/24 para a Inapa:
Inapa:

column2: No dia 28 de junho 2024 a Inapa foi analisada no CIA (referente a junho/24) em que ficou decidido por um lado colocar as empresas operacionais em stage 3 (ainda estavam em análise colectiva), e por outro, colocar a IPG com 100% imparidade o que resultou num reforço total de imparidade de 5M€, ficando com uma imparidade total já muito elevada de 88%, dado o grupo Inapa não dispor à data de meios financeiros para implementar as medidas de reestruturação e porque entendemos que a decisão da Parpublica quanto à proposta da Inapa, comportava forte probabilidade de não vir a ser deferida, o que inviabilizaria a parte da proposta aos Bancos. No entanto, não esquecer que havia ainda probabilidade da Parpublica (empresa estatal) injetar dinheiro na empresa;

no dia 21 de julho soubemos da rutura do negócio da Inapa Alemanha que levaria a Inapa à falência na Alemanha e que teriam défice de tesouraria de 12M€. No entanto, até essa data o requerimento da insolvência ainda não tinha sido publicado;
no dia 24 de julho foram aprovadas e reportadas as contas semestrais do Novo Banco;
no dia 1 de Agosto de 2024 foi finalmente publicado o requerimento de insolvência (ver em anexo);

no dia 2 de Agosto de 2024 foi efetuado o CIA referente a julho/24 em que o NB voltou a reforçar imparidade na Inapa em cerca de 1,7M€ (por via do requerimento de insolvência na Alemanha), reforçando para uma cobertura de cerca de 96% de imparidade.

column1: Consideramos ainda que a imparidade neste cliente não deverá estar a 100% dado a Inapa holding ter um plano em que está a tentar vender participações financeiras, tendo já vendido a Inapa Packaging por 20M€. Para a Inapa Portugal há um PER e nenhuma das empresas se encontra encerrada estando ainda em atividade.

Em suma, dado estes factos somos da opinião que este ponto não deveria ser considerado uma deficiência dado o Banco ter agido nos tempos devidos, e somos completamente contra o facto da deficiência se apresentar de relevância ‘Média’ em vez de ‘Baixa’ dado o NB ter agido logo que possível em todas as situações e os desvios já terem sido reconhecidos.

(Dez 23)","12/31/2023 12:00 AM","Auditor Externo","DC",,,"IFRS9",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","A.10","Assegurar a contratação dos recursos necessários bem como a retenção dos elementos seniores do Departamento de Rating

De acordo com número 4 do artigo 14º do Aviso 3/2020 do BdP, a instituição deve manter uma função de gestão de riscos que "" Dispõe de um número suficiente de colaboradores permanentemente qualificados, bem como de recursos materiais e técnicos adequados para o desempenho eficaz das suas responsabilidades"". Verificou-se que a função de gestão de riscos da instituição, nomeadamente o Departamento de Rating, apresenta uma grande concentração de tarefas num conjunto reduzido de recursos humanos, nomeadamente ao nível da Direção, o que pode colocar em causa o desempenho eficaz e tempestivo das suas responsabilidades face ao volume de trabalho existente.

A 31 de dezembro de 2023, verificamos que o projeto de risk transformation permanece em curso. As funções asseguradas no passado pelo DRT, foram transferidas para o DRG, DC e Underwriting Department. Embora estejam em curso alterações ao nível da estrutura de pessoal destes Departamentos, como por exemplo a contratação recente de uma diretora para Direção de Rating, não temos visibilidade sobre a efetividade das alterações ocorridas, algo que conseguiremos avaliar aquando da conclusão do projeto em curso.","A.10","Recomendamos que o Banco proceda à revisão da estrutura organizacional do departamento de forma a que consiga desempenhar de forma eficaz e tempestiva as suas responsabilidades.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio",,"Final",,"Concluída",,"(31/10/2024) - Medida encerrada.
Justificação:

'Com o processo todo do Risk Transformation que se encontra concluído à data, verificamos que as várias funções do DRT foram divididas essencialmente por 3 departamentos (DRG, DC e Underwriting). Verificamos que no DRT imparidade individual, a equipa foi reforçada com um elemento sénior (Pedro Soares) e já consta atualmente com mais 3 colaboradores com vasta experiência (Nuno Nascimento, Cláudia Valadas e Rui Eduardo como responsável). Esta equipa neste momento está apenas especializada em análise individual, tendo as restantes tarefas do DRT sido transferidas para outras áreas.","6/30/2024 12:00 AM","EY-JST_novobanco_followup findings RI_20241031_v1.0
705,"Relatório do Auditor Externo sobre
o processo de quantificação de
imparidade da carteira de crédito

(Dez 23)","12/31/2023 12:00 AM","Auditor Externo","DC",,,"IFRS9",,"Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","A.11","Intempestividade na marcação dos contratos como reestruturados na Carteira de Crédito
No decorrer da análise da marcação dos contratos como reestruturados na Loan Tape, foram selecionados dois meses de análise.

No mês de abril de 2022, atendendo ao atrasado da resposta das estruturas comerciais, que ocorreu nos meses de maio e de junho de 2022, só foram marcados posteriormente na loan tape de julho de 2022 como reestruturados.
Quanto aos contratos identificados na informação disponibilizada como reestruturados, a junho de 2022, só foram marcados como reestruturados na Loan tape com referência a dezembro de 2022.
Esta situação justificou-se por um atraso na marcação dos contratos por parte do DRT.

No decorrer dos nossos testes efetuados em 2023, não obstante o Banco ter implementados controlos que permitam identificar a marcação dos contratos restruturados, verificamos que continua a existir um intervalo temporal entre a identificação dos contratos e a sua respetiva marcação em sistema.","A.11","Recomendamos que o Banco implemente um controlo que permite assegurar a marcação tempestiva dos contratos reestruturados.",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio",,"Final",,"Concluída",,"(31/10/2024) - Medida encerrada.
Justificação:

No decorrer dos nossos testes efetuados no primeiro semestre de 2024, verificamos que o Banco tem controlos implementados que permitam identificar a marcação dos contratos restruturados na consola AGI. Em resultado dos nossos testes, não foi identificado nenhum contrato que não fosse atempadamente marcado na consola AGI. Não obstante, verificamos a existência de dois contratos em que a flag de reestruturado não se encontra marcada na Loan Tape pelo que abrimos uma nova deficiência ao nivel dos dados (D.13).","6/30/2024 12:00 AM","EY-JST_novobanco_followup findings RI_20241031_v1.0.xlsx","10/31/2024 10:18 AM","10/31/2024 10:24 AM"

717,"Relatório de Auditoria 49.00.2024","12/17/2024 12:00 AM","DAI","GDM",,,"IRB","Framework","N/A","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","1","Insuficiências na framework de monitorização pela CRCU","1","Rever e robustecer a framework de monitorização, com vista a implementar os aspetos identificados de forma a garantir a compreensão por terceiros dos testes a realizar e respetiva avaliação:

1. Garantir, no âmbito das análises ao poder preditivo, a avaliação do impacto da inclusão de dados recentes nas estimativas, conforme o estabelecido no parágrafo §218 (c)(i) das EBA/GL/2017/16, bem como tendo em consideração os parágrafos §132 e §135 do ECB Guide to internal models (CR) (versão em vigor). Rever, adicionalmente, neste âmbito, o enquadramento do teste binomial definido para avaliar se a PD final supera a LRA ODR, atualmente enquadrado no contexto de granularidade.
2. Incluir, no processo de monitorização as seguintes análises:
2.1 A avaliação do poder discriminante em termos absolutos, de acordo com os limites já definidos nos Anexos 11.4 e 11.5.;
2.2 No caso de modelos de PD diferenciados por submodelos de score distintos, complementar a avaliação do poder discriminante com a análise ao nível de cada um dos submodelos;
3. Rever os critérios de avaliação do poder discriminante dos fatores explicativos do modelo de score.

4. Rever e clarificar o contributo dos módulos, fatores explicativos, pontuação final e classe de PD para a avaliação dos testes de estabilidade, poder discriminante e de correlação de modo que a avaliação não pondere de forma múltipla o contributo de cada fator.

5. Enquadrar ao nível da avaliação da estabilidade e/ou representatividade as análises com o indicador PSI previstas na secção 3.5.2 e garantir que não contribuem duplamente para a avaliação do dashboard.
6. Avaliar a homogeneidade dos graus de risco com base em subamostras obtidas através da diferenciação do universo do grau de risco por risk drivers adequados ao invés de seleção aleatória.

7. Clarificar o processo de análise de correlações e rever os critérios de avaliação não se considerando adequado considerar o valor absoluto indicado no capítulo 11.1 da framework, dado que a análise de correlações deve ter igualmente em consideração a alteração do sinal de correlação.
8. Rever a matriz de decisão definida em framework e os critérios de avaliação tendo em consideração os aspetos identificados.
9. Clarificar a forma de avaliação global em modelos com mais do que um segmento de calibração, por forma a ser atribuída uma avaliação única ao modelo de PD.
10. Reforçar a listagem de controlos de data quality previstos com análises de coerência, definindo como mínimo, a verificação da coerência entre a PD aprovada e a usada para efeitos de capital.

Garantir igualmente a revisão e alinhamento com os aspetos já identificados no âmbito da medida 004224000000059.","11",,,"11","A framework de monitorização no âmbito dos modelos de IRB será revista considerando não só os aspetos identificados na medida 4224000000059 como também os listados neste finding #1.",,,"Risco Médio","4/30/2025 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso","004225000000042",,,,"1/30/2025 04:06 AM","2/13/2025 04:02 AM"

718,"Relatório de Auditoria 49.00.2024","12/17/2024 12:00 AM","DAI","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Todos os Segmentos","Em Produção","Deficiência de Processo","2","Insuficiências no exercício de monitorização pela CRCU ao nível do processo de construção de amostras e aplicação inconsistente e incompleta da framework metodológica","2","1. Implementar, nos futuros exercícios de monitorização de modelos de PD, os seguintes aspetos:

1.1 Aplicar de forma completa e consistente a framework de monitorização. Nomeadamente ao nível da execução dos testes, da aplicação de thresholds e da avaliação de resultados, contemplando todos os testes definidos ou, no caso da impossibilidade de realização de algum deles, justificando convenientemente a mesma. Rever, em particular, o cálculo de casos de sucesso em cada dimensão de análise de forma a terem em consideração no denominador todos os casos analisados.
1.2 Evidenciar a revisão do exercício realizado por supervisor, com vista a garantir a correta aplicação da framework.
1.3 Agregar os resultados das várias dimensões analisadas no dashboard definido em framework e garantir a avaliação final por modelo, devidamente documentada e justificada.
1.4 Incluir em anexo ao “Relatório” de monitorização a ficha técnica de monitorização devidamente preenchida.
1.5 Documentar a análise critica aos controlos de qualidade realizados.
1.6 Usar diretamente os dados da amostra considerada na última calibração, com vista a garantir resultados
comparáveis com a mesma.
1.7 Discretizar, para efeitos de análise de estabilidade, apenas as variáveis continuas e usar diretamente as classes

das variáveis discretas para este efeito. No caso das variáveis contínuas, adotar uma abordagem de discretização coerente entre variáveis, tendo em consideração os 3 percentis (P25, P50 e P75) observados na
amostra de calibração.
1.8 Corrigir o cálculo do Indicador de Herfindahl normalizado, substituindo “N” por número de classes.

1.9 Rever o cálculo do peso de unrated, sendo que, no modelo de originação pode ser aceitável o cálculo sobre o universo sem reestruturados, dado que a PD respetiva é independente do score do modelo, desde que devidamente documentado e justificado este aspeto no “Relatório” de monitorização.
1.10 Desconsiderar, para efeitos de avaliação dos testes à correlação, o resultado da correlação entre o score final e ele próprio, bem como com o bucket de PD.
2. Implementar, nos futuros exercícios de monitorização, as seguintes correções no processo de construção da amostra de monitorização:
2.1 Rever os pontos de corte usados na construção das classes de PD com o número de casas decimais definido para efeitos de produção.

2.2 Rever a fórmula de cálculo da idade do interveniente de forma alinhada com a considerada para efeitos de produção e confirmar o alinhamento dos scores dos fatores explicativos recalculados com a restante informação de produção, isto é, replicando o recálculo do score do módulo sociodemográfico com base nos scores recalculados e confirmar que se obtém o mesmo score que o armazenado nas tabelas com informação de produção.

2.3 Incluir a chave primária da amostra de monitorização na visão de interveniente (IDPN).","13",,,"13","Os aspetos supra indicados pelo DAI serão acomodados no exercício de monitorização do modelo de originação a realizar numa data subsequente à revisão e consequente aprovação da framework de monitorização.",,,"Risco Médio","9/30/2025 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso","004225000000043",,,,"1/30/2025 05:29 AM","2/13/2025 04:02 AM"

722,"Relatório de Auditoria 49.00.2024","12/17/2024 12:00 AM","DAI","GVM",,,"IRB","Framework","N/A","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","6","Insuficiências no processo de validação recorrente","6","1. Realizar todos os testes previstos na framework ou, na impossibilidade da sua realização, justificar adequadamente a mesma. No que se refere às análises de qualidade dos dados usados no exercício de validação recorrente, o GVM deve ter em consideração a análise dos relatórios sobre qualidade de dados do CDO Office que se encontrem disponíveis, conforme previsto em framework, mas, no caso dos mesmos não existirem ou não serem completos, em termos de dimensões de análise, ou dos dados usados pelo GVM, o GVM deve efetuar as análises adicionais necessárias com vista a garantir que todas as dimensões de análise e dados relevantes são cobertos.

2. Descrever, na documentação de suporte aos exercícios de validação recorrente, o racional para atribuição da classificação em cada uma das dimensões de análise (quer intermédias, quer finais) e aplicar as regras de agregação que estão pré-definidas em framework.

3. Executar os testes à calibração conforme o definido em framework, isto é, assentando a comparação das PD com o máximo entre a taxa média de longo prazo do horizonte temporal atualizado e a taxa correspondente à LRDR dos últimos 5 anos.

4. Documentar e justificar convenientemente, em cada exercício, a adequação do horizonte temporal selecionado para efeitos de cálculo da LRDR (nos testes à calibração), em termos da representatividade da variabilidade esperada das default rates observadas.
5. Calcular a LRDR usada para efeitos de backtesting como média simples das ODR mensais do período selecionado.

6. Evidenciar a análise dos resultados de backtesting à luz da filosofia de rating proposta e o momento do ciclo económico (expansão ou recessão), conforme o exigido §66 das EBA/GL/2017/16 e em §46 de EBA/REP/2023/29.
7. Completar o exercício de backtesting com a análise ao segmento unscored, com vista a garantir o adequado nível de conservadorismo da PD aplicada.

8. No teste de coerência entre a PD da amostra de validação e a PD considerada para efeitos de cálculo de RWA deve ser analisada a origem das diferenças, quando existem, com vista a confirmar que não se trata de inconsistências do processo do GVM, uma vez que, nesse caso o GVM deve rever as amostras de validação em conformidade.
9. Corrigir para 5% o nível de significância aplicado para avaliação do Jeffrey's test ao Portfolio (Validation Report BCE - apresentado na página 20 do Relatório de Validação).
10. Realizar os testes de heterogeneidade de acordo com o que está descrito na framework, isto é, com a aplicação de um teste bilateral com 90% de confiança.

11. Rever os templates de Relatório em vigor e garantir que os thresholds apresentados se encontram alinhados com os definidos na framework de validação em vigor.","11",,"9","2","Os relatórios de validação produzidos este ano foram revistos com a correção dos lapsos referenciados, criando assim controlos adicionais para as próximas validações, uma vez que o relatório e suportes do exercício anterior, servem como referência para a validação seguinte. Acresce ainda que foram incluídos slides em anexo com o detalhe das análises de representatividade realizadas no exercício bem como os testes previstos no framework que não foram realizados, com o respetivo racional para a sua não aplicabilidade no exercício/modelo em avaliação. Independentemente das ações já implementadas, propomos ainda:
A) o GVM irá clarificar no framework de validação:
- a natureza de testes não aplicáveis a modelos de Originação.
- o scorecard se encontra na perspetiva LR, e que análise adicionas realizada a 5 anos são entendidas como complementares para servir de possíveis sinais de alerta.

- Clarificar o propósito dos testes complementares no framework, dado que se trata de possíveis análises adicionais para explorar e aprofundar certas situações, quando existem, e não de testes mandatários a incluir em todos os exercícios.
- a metodologia e critérios para aplicar testes de heterogeneidade (Dez-2025)
B) Em futuros relatórios, o GVM:
- Irá aumentar o nível de fundamentação escrita sobre como determinou o seu resultado final de cada teste obrigatório
- Passará a emitir findings de validação aos processos de monitorização informática sempre que identifique caso de clientes unrated em modelos automáticos.
- Passará a incluir a expressão “análise da filosofia de rating” nos capítulos que já produz sobre essa matéria
- Incluirá a explicação dos motivos para determinação do Powerstat através da PD quando os segmentos de calibração não usam a mesma escala.
- Reforçará os mecanismos de controlo de ficheiros para assegurar a minimização de eventuais lapsos nas fórmulas que possa dar lugar a incorretas interpretações de resultados. (Jan-2026)

726,"Relatório de Auditoria 60.00.2024","1/28/2025 12:00 AM","DAI","GDM",,"DRG-GRM","IRB","Framework","N/A","Em Produção","Deficiência de Documentos","1","Insuficiências na governação do método IRB.","1","1. Definir, na framework do Método IRB (inclui os documentos Framework Método IRB – Definição de Procedimentos e Governance e Política de Classificação de Alterações), de forma objetiva, clara e coerente, as estruturas/subestruturas orgânicas que integram, atualmente, a governação do método IRB, bem como as funções e responsabilidades que lhes estão atribuídas. 739,"GVM 283-2025 - IRRBB Prepayment Model 2024 - Validation Assessment","2/28/2025 12:00 AM","CM","DRG","DRG Riscos de Mercados",,"ICAAP","N/A","IRRBB - Prepayments","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","1","The model was considered unsuitable for use for the following situations:
- Low quality of the data used, with evidence indicating that a significant number of contracts classified as prepayments were actually debt renegotiations;

-Gaps in historical information and data errors highlight a weak data control environment. The documentation does not provide any indication regarding this dimension, nor were monitoring DQ evidence made available;
- The consideration of outlier events impacts the dataset used. The individual case by case analysis highlighted data errors (false prepayments);

-  For certain segments, models with overly complex applicability were proposed, without  roviding clear evidence of their superiority in terms of accuracy and backtesting, when compared to other alternatives;

- Considering a single parameter for the corporate portfolio seems overly simplistic, given the different characteristics of the clients, varying levels of involvement, and distinct early repayments profile.","1","The DRG should make the following corrections:
- Conduct data analyses to validate the information used in parameter estimation (enhance data assessment);
- Review the parameters applied to the Corporate portfolio;
- Assess whether the implemented data controls are sufficient and robust to mitigate the risk of recurring errors and historical data gaps.;
- Provide model stakeholders with regular data quality monitoring reports, incorporating the aforementioned controls;
- Enhance data assessment of outliers information;

- Conduct backtesting tests and analyses to compare the performance of the models (either at the contract level or through aggregated time series), in order to assess the cost benefit of adopting more complex procedures for parameter determination;

- Test and analyze different segmentation approaches, considering factors such as the client’s overall involvement or the size of the business (despite the data quality limitations, evidence indicates that clients with exposure bellow €1M exhibit lower prepayment rates).","7","2",,"5",,,,"Risco Alto",,"Provisório",,"Em Curso",,,,,"3/11/2025 03:46 AM","3/11/2025 06:50 AM"

745,"GVM 218-2023  Risco Operacional Model - High level assessment","11/30/2023 12:00 AM","CM","DRG","DRG Riscos Não Financeiros e Cultura de Risco",,"ICAAP","N/A","Risco Operacional","Em Produção","Deficiência de Modelo","1","Significant weaknesses were found by the validation regarding the Operational Risk Model.","1","It is recommended to review the model considering the deficiencies identified during validation, namely:

-Insufficient Data Quality: The data from AGIRO is inadequate for accurate quantification and modeling of operational risk, as the majority of records do not represent actual losses. It is unclear whether all risks are reflected in AGIRO, as required by NG 0005/2007;
-Data Enrichment Needed: AGIRO's records, particularly for events with significant losses, must be improved through mandatory fields and stricter completion guidelines;
-Reconciliation Procedures: Procedures to verify that incurred losses are fully recorded need to be implemented;

-Model Sample Construction Flaws: The model's sample was built using filters that eliminated 80% of AGIRO's data, and the majority of remaining events involve IT issues with low average losses (~€1,000);
-Bias in Loss Inference Methodology: The model's loss inference is heavily skewed by extreme, specific outliers that should be treated qualitatively without impacting statistical distributions;
-Documentation Gaps: The model's documentation shows inconsistencies and limitations, requiring better justification or corrections;

-Statistical Significance Issues: The model's segmentation is compromised by insufficient statistical significance, forcing the aggregation of events with different nature and frequency.","7","2","1","4",,,,"Risco Alto",,"Provisório",,"Em Curso",,"(18/02/2025) - In accordance with Ata #104, the reassessment of the model was carried out by the Bank, with the support of Oliver Wyman, and GVM validated the new version earlier this year (GVM 263/2024). The validation team identified some shortcomings, but none that significantly impact the VaR. The shortcomes are:
▪ Several credit risk events were incorrectly categorized and should not have been excluded from scope.
▪ Documentation requires reassessment to ensure a clear and accurate understanding of the assumptions considered.
▪ The reliance on an ""x25 median factor"" lacks sufficient support and contradicts prior data analyses.",,,"3/11/2025 06:12 AM","3/11/2025 08:29 AM"

753,"IMI-2024-PTNOB-0240431","3/24/2025 12:00 AM","Supervisor","GDM",,,"IRB","PD","Crédito Habitação Originação","Aprovado e em Implementação","Deficiência de Processo","6","The following deficiencies were identified in the PD quantification process:

• The quantification RDS includes exposures that are out of scope of the model, namely cases of facilities granted in the context of the obligor’s bankruptcy that pertain to products other than mortgages.
• In what concerns the representativeness of data, the Supervised Entity did not perform statistical tests to compare the distribution of risk characteristics in the RDS vs the application portfolio.
• Regarding the period representative of the LRoV:

- The Supervised Entity does not fully justify the choice of the set of macroeconomic variables, nor the respective period analysed to assess the Likely Range of Variability and why specific macroeconomic variables directly related to the portfolio, such as Housing Price Index (HPI), were not considered. The period selected is particularly relevant since the data is normalised and the minimum and maximum considered for this effect influence the classification of years as good or bad;

- For the ODR variability, the Supervised Entity limits the beginning of the period considered to 2010, despite the fact that the model is implemented since 2004 with respective available default information, although not according to the new DoD. Although it can be argued that an already acceptable proportion of bad years is achieved when considering the data from 2010 onwards, this conclusion may change when using a longer period that may affect the classification of each year as good/bad.

- The Supervised Entity does not have any thresholds established to determine which proportion between good and bad years should be considered adequate and which should trigger the inclusion of additional periods.

• Regarding the bucketing process, although initial buckets are defined through an automatic algorithm, they are then completely redefined through expert judgment, which is not properly documented and there are no specific criteria defined to reach the final cut-offs, making it impossible for a third party to independently replicate the process. Additionally, the Supervised Entity decided to define the first grade of the existing clients segment with a scoring interval that has no record of defaults in the whole RDS, making it impossible to accurately perform a quantification for this grade that can be properly tested. Moreover, the bucketing process is conducted considering only 70% of the available data, while the remaining 30% are used for out-of-sample testing and the Supervised Entity did not assess whether this data split introduces some bias to the final cut-off values, nor duly justifies the need for this partition.","N/A","Finding sem Obligation",,,,,,,,"Risco Médio","12/31/2027 12:00 AM","Final",,"Em Curso - Sem Obligation",,"(12/03/2025) - Esta medida não foi registada por lapso, tendo apenas sido registada à data.
